page.title: 07VILLAGES IN THE DALE
page.content: Most of the dwellings in our area are in the very small villages of{Booze, {Langthwaite, and Arkle Town.}The largest village, Langthwaite, has a mere 42 houses and only 15 are lived in permanently. The remaining houses are used as holiday cottages except for two which are empty. In recent years many film makers have used Langthwaite and nearby properties because of their old-world charm. The site of Langthwaite dates back to{Viking times}from where it gained its name. Most of the village nestles between the river and the steep wooded hillside. Many of the houses were built in the{17th {century}around an open central area which is still partly cobbled. The only way into Langthwaite is across an old picturesque stone bridge over the river.
